newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania Banca Agricola cuts leu deposit rates.
newsitem.headline: Romania Banca Agricola cuts leu deposit rates.

text.p: Romanian state-owned bank Banca Agricola SA said it had cut interest rates on individuals' leu deposits starting on Monday.
A bank statement showed the annual rate on one-month deposits dropped to 65 percent from 95 percent, with three-month deposits rate down to 75 percent from 96 percent.

The move follows recent drops in Romanian banks' deposit rates after monthly inflation slowed down to 4.3 percent last month from 6.9 percent in April and a record 30.7 percent in March when fuel, energy and food prices were liberalised.
Six-month deposits will carry 76 percent annual interest, sharply down from a previous 96 percent, while the rate on one-year deposits fell to 78 percent from 99 percent.
Sight deposit rates stayed flat at an annual 20 percent.
Banca Agricola farm lender is a leading state-run bank likely to turn private under a bank selloff bill passed earlier this year.
